children.desc: Fan Fault
Thermtrip- Thermal trip indicated from SP5 (sticky since fpga reset or last clear)
SMERR_L asserted low while CPU was powered up
A1A0 MAPO- A fault in the A1-A0 domain(s) caused a MAPO (sticky since fpga reset or last clear)
Nic MAPO- A fault in the A0 domain caused a MAPO (sticky since fpga reset or last clear)
AMD PWROK falling edge while in >=A0 (sticky since fpga reset or last clear)
AMD RESET falling edge while in >=A0 (sticky since fpga reset or last clear)

Thermtrip- Thermal trip indicated from SP5 (sticky since fpga reset or last clear)

NIC power OK
Interrupt Pending Status (set if any enabled IRQ has its flag set)
Fan East hotswap disable
Fan Central hotswap disable
Fan West hotswap disable
Fan Fail: inversion of MAX31790ATI FAN_FAIL_N output (1=Fail asserted)
Readback of fan East hotswap PG pin
Readback of fan Central hotswap PG pin
Readback of fan West hotswap PG pin
Readback of fan East hotswap disable pin
Readback of fan Central hotswap disable pin
Readback of fan West hotswap disable pin

A0 Group power enable (starts state machine). 
Note, no discrete A1 state control, it's a transitory state on the way to A0.
Set to '1' to start the A2->A0/HP sequence. Set to '0' to disable, power off.
Note that for fault cases, sw must clear and re-enable this bit as the state
machine only enables in response to rising edge changes.
Sequencer Status
Sequencer Raw Status
Nic SM Status
NIC Sequencer Raw Status
Falling edge counter of AMD's reset output while in A0/A0HP. Saturates at 255. Cleared by any write or starting a new power up
Falling edge counter of AMD's PowerOK output while in A0/A0HP. Saturates at 255.  Cleared by any write or starting a new power up

SMERR_L live status, note: only valid when SP5 rails are up (From SP5)
Thermtrip_l live status, note: only valid when SP5 rails are up (From SP5)
reset_l live status, note: only valid when SP5 rails are up (From SP5)
pwr_ok live status, note: only meaningful when SP5 rails are up (From SP5)
slp_s3_l live status, note: only valid when SP5 rails are up (or being sequenced up) (From SP5)
slp_s5_l live status, note: only valid when SP5 rails are up (or being sequenced up) (From SP5)
rsmrst_l live status, (From FPGA to SP5)
pwr_btn_l live status, (From FPGA to SP5)
pwr_btn_l live status, (From FPGA to SP5)
cld_rst_l live status, (From FPGA to NIC)
perst_l live status, (From FPGA to NIC)
nic_mfg_mode_l live status, (From FPGA to NIC)
eeprom_wp_l live status, note: only valid when SP5 rails are up (From FPGA to eeprom)
eeprom_wp_buffer_oe_l live status, note: only valid when SP5 rails are up (From FPGA to buffer)
flash_wp_l live status, note: only valid when SP5 rails are up (From FPGA to flash)
nic_pcie_clk_buff_oe_l live status, note: only valid when SP5 rails are up (From FPGA to buffer)
ext_rst_l live status, note: only valid when NIC rails are up (From NIC)
sp5_mfg_mode_l live status, (From SP5 to FPGA)

Ignore sp5 allows the sequencer to bypass any SP5-related handshakes
for power debugging. Some rails may not completely power up without a load-slammer
or other feedback device in place.
Set to mux in the nic_override signals instead of the normal nic control signals
Used for manually controlling the nic reset for debugging purposes
Let other logic run but directly force mfg mode_l to be asserted when set
cld_rst_l live status, (From FPGA to NIC)
perst_l live status, (From FPGA to NIC)
nic_mfg_mode_l live status, (From FPGA to NIC)

eeprom_wp_buffer_oe_l live status, note: only valid when SP5 rails are up (From FPGA to buffer)
flash_wp_l live status, note: only valid when SP5 rails are up (From FPGA to flash)
nic_pcie_clk_buff_oe_l live status, note: only valid when SP5 rails are up (From FPGA to buffer)
Set to 1 to isolate front FPGA and be connected to ignition flash instead
Ignition reconfigure trigger. This latches on once set since ignition should powercycle the IBC. Setting this bit results in an SP power-cycle
